23rd September 1933.
Shanghai.
Personal & Confidential.
Letter No.
Mr.
Pacific American
Pio Amerian Airweyst,
New York.
Dear Mr. Morgan,
This is thefirst opportunity
that I have had to
morning)since reggipt of your letter regarding Howard.
is an extremelyletter for me to write because of my warm personal
friendship for Howard, and the personal gratification which I
would have in being associated with him.
In my opinion, he is
qualified in every way to represent Fan American Airweys as
Division Manager of the Company's Fer Eastern operation.
He hes
the complete confidence of
every one with whom he came in contact
during his stay in china.
He has a good general knowledge of
Chinese economicz and
political affairs, and he is possessed of
a happy faculty
of getting along with the Chinese.
I hope you
will pardon my frequent reference to this quality; as a matter of
Some-one has defined the word "gentleman" as a *man
who is always
considerate of others!
is ho country which
I have ever visited where the quality breeding and gentlemanly
conduct is as important as in China.
A report of the slightest
affront to the lowest coolie will quickly travel to the highest
officials, and the party guilty of
such
conduct toward any Chinese
will find
himself blocked in any undertaking which he may attempt
without evelt knowing the reason.why such obstacles are thrown in
his way.
Howard is keenly awere of this sensitiveness and pride
on the part of
the Chinese.
I wodid never have to worry about his
conduct in that regard.
He is correct in his statementll that he has had
considerably experience in conducting negotiations with Chinese
officials.
In those negotiations he was tactful and straight
forward; he is inclined to take things very seriously and to
carry his problems home with himto worry over all night, which
in my opinion is a weakness.
Howard has undoubtedly received
other offers to return to Chine as representative of various
concerns desiring to sell products to
the Chinese Government.
He would undoubtedly rather join Pan American Airways.
He is
he is in no
sense a high
pressure salesmen,
entirely in his wearing qualities.
Answering the 3 points enumerated in your letter
